reviewText: Having familiarised myself with the Tae Bo Basics workout, I was not surprised to find the Advanced truly worthy of its title. An absolutely staggering workout and one that I have a love/hate relationship with. I  love what it does for me and know that it is a really effective hour of  exercise, but while I'm swinging my leg up and down for what feels like the  hundredth time and Billy is still rambling on about 'reaching deep down',  his throat is the only thing I feel like reaching for!(His heart - not to  mention his buns - is in the right place though!).I can understand  trepidation on the part of some reviewers and I do not think this is a tape  for anyone who (a) is not familiar with the basics of Tae Bo and (b) is not  fairly athletic already and can cope with the occasional excessively fast  kicks and punches. Having said that though, I started slowly in order to  'acclimatise' to the movements and, as with everything, I find my technique  improves with each workout, which in itself  reduces the risk of injury.I also recommend a good stretch-out after the tape because Billy does not  concentrate too heavily on this area and after the first few attempts, just  getting out of bed the next day was a bigger challenge than the tape  itself! Better stretching quickly rectified this stiffness for me.Overall though, I love this tape and may need to update it to DVD soon  because it's certainly well-used by both my partner and I. It is now my  only exercise video in use.And incidentally, the Tae Bo web page has  some great 'before and after' exercisers in the event of anyone needing  motivation. I find them fascinating personally!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an amazing, mind-changing video.  I spent awhile opposed to "classic" forms of exercise, and then this came along.  It appeals to the deepest parts of you, that want to SCREAM! and throw yourself at the mercy of your own adrenalin.  It really, honestly doesn't feel like exercise.  Although it did take me forever to finally make it through the whole tape without stopping to catch my breath and recover from muscle failure!I would recommend completing the instructional and basic tapes first, to get the idea of what kinds of moves Billy Blanks will be using.  He uses almost all the same moves from these two tapes, but at a much quicker pace and in longer reps.If you are a martial arts student, you may either enjoy this and the other Tae Bo tapes immensely, or you may totally dislike it!  I myself am a martial arts student, and while the technique he displays is not the one I am taught to use, I just remind myself that this video is for exercise, not instruction in self-defense.  I even tweak it somewhat to retain my own muscle memory, when possible.I appreciate the use of so many different kinds of people in the background...men, women, tall and skinny, short and muscular.  But each person's physique is inspiring--you just say to yourself, "I want that!"  And away you go!I highly recommend this tape for advanced exercisers, or beginners who are willing to take it a step at a time until they can finish the whole tape.  It will really make you scream out loud, and you'll feel GREAT for it!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Nowadays, I have been missing my gym appointments.  Good thing I have the Taebo tape at home to perk me up.  Nothing beats a sweat-pouring muscle-crunching workout after a tiresome day at work.  & what's so great about this is that you get your cardio workout like in aerobics but at the same time you get to tone your muscles through all those punches & kicks.I may sound like a paid-out person giving a testimony on a TV/mail-order product, but I instantly felt & saw results in my physique.  My thighs/legs became leaner & firmer and I lost a few centimeters on  my waistline.Great work out!  Common, squeeze those abs!

reviewText: The advanced video is super hard to do. I sometimes can barly finnish it. I consider myself to be somewhere in the intermidiate level of fittness ability and this video makes me work hard! I cant say enough about it. Your heart rate really gets up and you sweat big time. Also the music gets you energised. Billy Blanks is really encoraging and funny like when one of the guys in back starts slowing down and he sees him and encourages him to get up and not quit! If you are a beginner dont start with this tape try his beginnig tape and work up to the advanced and when your ready GET THIS TAPE! If you are an excesiser who likes kickboxing you will love this also. It has alot of kickboxing elements and matial arts too. You will love this tape!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: My mom bought Tae Bo for back in the 90's when I was a chubby kid after a school fitness exam deemed me as an obese child. I lost 20 lbs that summer when I was working out and got healthy. I will always have a place in my heart for this exercise program which I had to buy twice after losing the first VHS I had. I know the craze these days are Insanity and P90X and people tend to laugh at the 90's campiness of Tae Bo but guess what, IT WORKS! Billy Blanks is extremely funny, motivating, and everyone in the video is very fun and motivating. I would recommend this specific Tae-Bo VHS (if you still have a vcr player) since many of the Tae-Bo tapes and DVDs I've bought since then (Tae-Bo Live, Boot Camp...etc.) just don't match the workouts in this VHS tape. I have Insanity also, which I recommend as well, and the cardio moves seen in Insanity are in Tae Bo as well.In Tae-Bo Advanced, you don't just do a series of kicks and punches, you do multiple variations of kickboxing moves and then raise the routine by moving double time. What I like about Tae-Bo is...there's no such thing as a water break...you always move and jog in place between moves so your heart is racing throughout and you're sweating throughout. Tae Bo WORKS!
summary: Quite possibly the best workout program I've ever owned!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Seriously. I just canceled my gym membership.I orginally bought these tapes back when the first came out. Someone was selling the vcd on ebay so I bought it.I forgot how fun and intense this work out is! I have 3 "newer" Tae-Bo dvds, but NOTHING beats the original.People must have complained about the intensity of the advanced tape. Maybe possible injuries because they didn't use proper form?After my first workout, I was literally sweating from head to toe. This is a great all over workout!I was also happy to make it through the whole tape only stopping once. 10 years ago, i couldn't make it through the whole thing.Anyway, I've only been doing this workout for a week. I will update on my progress. Btw, If you're looking for a quick workout I also recommend Jilliam Michaels Shred. Or just do 30minutes of this tape w/a cool down.
summary: Forget the gym! Use this instead

reviewText: The video was quite impressive.  It is a real full workout.  Though it is called advanced, the technique of the moves wasn't all that difficult.  However, the exercises are intense, therefore you can certainly get your heart rate going.  When he moves on to the next exercises, he shows the moves slowly once, and you get to try them out slowly several times before he picks up the pace.  All the moves are well expained and easy to comprehend.  This video is strongly recommended and I would certainly try out the Tae-bo Live as well.
